qas.question: Who states that Christian believers agree that Jesus has a unique significance?
Who wrote The Case Against Christianity?
How many historical Christian creeds did Martin write about?
What do Christians believe is the way to salvation?
What are the three creeds Martin studied?

answers.text: the Apostles' Creed, the Nicene Creed and the Athanasian Creed

qas.question: According to Nicene Creed, what can Christians be united in believing?
Who do Christians believe has a unique insignificance?
Who wrote The Case Against Creed?
Who is the author of The Apostles Creed?
Who is the author of The Nicene Creed?

context: <a0_0>Linda Woodhead<a0_0/> attempts to provide a common belief thread for Christians by noting that "Whatever else they might disagree about, Christians are at least united in believing that <b5_0><b6_0>Jesus<b6_0/> has a unique significance<b5_0/>." Philosopher <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>Michael Martin<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>, in his book The Case Against Christianity, evaluated <a2_0>three<a2_0/> historical Christian creeds (<a4_0>the Apostles' Creed, the Nicene Creed and the Athanasian Creed<a4_0/>) to establish a set of basic assumptions which include belief in theism, the historicity of Jesus, the Incarnation, salvation through <a3_0>faith in Jesus<a3_0/>, and Jesus as an ethical role model.
